verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of Agur <S%H94><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jakeh, <S%H3348><s%> even the prophecy: <S%H4853><s%> the man <S%H1397><s%> spoke <S%H5002><s%> to Ithiel, <S%H384><s%> even to Ithiel <S%H384><s%> and Ucal, <S%H401><s%>
Surely <S%H3588><s%> I am more brutish <S%H1197><s%> than any man, <S%H376><s%> and have not the understanding <S%H998><s%> of a man. <S%H120><s%>
I neither <S%H3808><s%> learned <S%H3925><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> nor have the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the holy. <S%H6918><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> has ascended <S%H5927><s%> up into heaven, <S%H8064><s%> or descended? <S%H3381><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> has gathered <S%H622><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> in his fists? <S%H2651><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> has bound <S%H6887><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> in a garment? <S%H8071><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> has established <S%H6965><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the ends <S%H657><s%> of the earth? <S%H776><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> is his name, <S%H8034><s%> and what <S%H4100><s%> is his son's <S%H1121><s%> name, <S%H8034><s%> if you can tell? <S%H3045><s%>
Every <S%H3605><s%> word <S%H565><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> is pure: <S%H6884><s%> he is a shield <S%H4043><s%> to them that put their trust <S%H2620><s%> in him.
Add <S%H3254><s%> you not to his words, <S%H1697><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he reprove <S%H3198><s%> you, and you be found a liar. <S%H376><s%> <S%H3576><s%>
Two <S%H8147><s%> things have I required <S%H7592><s%> of you; deny <S%H4513><s%> me them not before <S%H2962><s%> I die: <S%H4191><s%>

Remove <S%H7368><s%> far <S%H7369><s%> from me vanity <S%H7723><s%> and lies: <S%H3576><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> me neither <S%H408><s%> poverty <S%H7389><s%> nor riches; <S%H6239><s%> feed <S%H2963><s%> me with food <S%H3899><s%> convenient <S%H2706><s%> for me:

Lest <S%H6435><s%> I be full, <S%H7646><s%> and deny <S%H3584><s%> you, and say, <S%H559><s%> Who <S%H4310><s%> is the LORD? <S%H3068><s%> or lest <S%H6435><s%> I be poor, <S%H3423><s%> and steal, <S%H1589><s%> and take <S%H8610><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of my God <S%H430><s%> in vain.
Accuse <S%H3960><s%> not a servant <S%H5650><s%> to his master, <S%H113><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he curse <S%H7043><s%> you, and you be found guilty. <S%H816><s%>
There is a generation <S%H1755><s%> that curses <S%H7043><s%> their father, <S%H1><s%> and does not bless <S%H1288><s%> their mother. <S%H517><s%>
There is a generation <S%H1755><s%> that are pure <S%H2889><s%> in their own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and yet is not washed <S%H7364><s%> from their filthiness. <S%H6675><s%>
There is a generation, <S%H1755><s%> O how <S%H4100><s%> lofty <S%H7311><s%> are their eyes! <S%H5869><s%> and their eyelids <S%H6079><s%> are lifted <S%H5375><s%> up.

There is a generation, <S%H1755><s%> whose teeth <S%H8127><s%> are as swords, <S%H2719><s%> and their jaw <S%H4973><s%> teeth <S%H4973><s%> as knives, <S%H3979><s%> to devour <S%H398><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> from off the earth, <S%H776><s%> and the needy <S%H34><s%> from among men. <S%H120><s%>

The horse leach <S%H5936><s%> has two <S%H8147><s%> daughters, <S%H1323><s%> crying, Give, <S%H3051><s%> give. <S%H3051><s%> There are three <S%H7969><s%> things that are never <S%H3808><s%> satisfied, <S%H7646><s%> yes, four <S%H702><s%> things say <S%H559><s%> not, It is enough: <S%H1952><s%>

The grave; <S%H7585><s%> and the barren <S%H6115><s%> womb; <S%H7356><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> that is not filled <S%H7646><s%> with water; <S%H4325><s%> and the fire <S%H784><s%> that said <S%H559><s%> not, It is enough. <S%H1952><s%>

The eye <S%H5869><s%> that mocks <S%H3932><s%> at his father, <S%H1><s%> and despises <S%H936><s%> to obey <S%H3349><s%> his mother, <S%H517><s%> the ravens <S%H6158><s%> of the valley <S%H5158><s%> shall pick <S%H5365><s%> it out, and the young <S%H1121><s%> eagles <S%H5404><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> it.
There be three <S%H7969><s%> things which are too wonderful <S%H6381><s%> for me, yes, four <S%H702><s%> which I know <S%H3045><s%> not:

The way <S%H1870><s%> of an eagle <S%H5404><s%> in the air; <S%H8064><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> of a serpent <S%H5175><s%> on a rock; <S%H6697><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> of a ship <S%H591><s%> in the middle <S%H3820><s%> of the sea; <S%H3220><s%> and the way <S%H1870><s%> of a man <S%H1397><s%> with a maid. <S%H5959><s%>

Such <S%H3651><s%> is the way <S%H1870><s%> of an adulterous <S%H5003><s%> woman; <S%H802><s%> she eats, <S%H398><s%> and wipes <S%H4229><s%> her mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> I have done <S%H6466><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> wickedness. <S%H205><s%>
For three <S%H7969><s%> things the earth <S%H776><s%> is disquieted, <S%H7264><s%> and for four <S%H702><s%> which it cannot <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3201><s%> bear: <S%H5375><s%>
For a servant <S%H5650><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he reigns; <S%H4427><s%> and a fool <S%H5036><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he is filled <S%H7646><s%> with meat; <S%H3899><s%>
For an odious <S%H8130><s%> woman when <S%H3588><s%> she is married; <S%H1166><s%> and an handmaid <S%H8198><s%> that is heir <S%H3423><s%> to her mistress. <S%H1404><s%>
There be four <S%H702><s%> things which are little <S%H6996><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> but they are exceeding wise: <S%H2450><s%>
The ants <S%H5244><s%> are a people <S%H5971><s%> not strong, <S%H5794><s%> yet they prepare <S%H3559><s%> their meat <S%H3899><s%> in the summer; <S%H7019><s%>
The conies <S%H8227><s%> are but a feeble <S%H3808><s%> <S%H6099><s%> folk, <S%H5971><s%> yet make <S%H7760><s%> they their houses <S%H1004><s%> in the rocks; <S%H5553><s%>
The locusts <S%H697><s%> have no <S%H369><s%> king, <S%H4428><s%> yet go <S%H3318><s%> they forth <S%H3318><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> of them by bands; <S%H2686><s%>
The spider <S%H8079><s%> takes <S%H8610><s%> hold <S%H8610><s%> with her hands, <S%H3027><s%> and is in kings' <S%H4428><s%> palaces. <S%H1964><s%>
There be three <S%H7969><s%> things which go <S%H3190><s%> well, <S%H3190><s%> yes, four <S%H702><s%> are comely <S%H3190><s%> in going: <S%H3212><s%>
A lion <S%H3918><s%> which is strongest <S%H1368><s%> among beasts, <S%H929><s%> and turns <S%H7725><s%> not away for any; <S%H3605><s%>

A greyhound; <S%H2223><s%> <S%H4975><s%> an he goat <S%H8495><s%> also; <S%H176><s%> and a king, <S%H4428><s%> against <S%H5973><s%> whom <S%H5973><s%> there is no <S%H510><s%> rising <S%H510><s%> up.

If <S%H518><s%> you have done foolishly <S%H5034><s%> in lifting <S%H5375><s%> up yourself, or if <S%H518><s%> you have thought <S%H2161><s%> evil, lay your hand <S%H3027><s%> on your mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

Surely <S%H3588><s%> the churning <S%H4330><s%> of milk <S%H2461><s%> brings <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> butter, <S%H2529><s%> and the wringing <S%H4330><s%> of the nose <S%H639><s%> brings <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> blood: <S%H1818><s%> so the forcing <S%H4330><s%> of wrath <S%H639><s%> brings <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> strife. <S%H7379><s%>
